page.title: 09ECOLOGY
page.content:
CIRENCESTER PARK MEADOW. {} IT IS A HERB RICH LIMESTONE PASTURE WITH SHALLOW SOIL. IT IS CUT ANNUALLY IN JULY AND IS USED AS AN OPEN AREA FOR DEER. THE MEADOW IS DOMINATED BY {ZERNA ERECTA} BUT OTHER INTERESTING SPECIES INCLUDE {ALCHEMILLA, THYMUS, {ANACAMPTIS PYRAMIDALIS, LISTERA OVATA, {ORCHIS FUCHSII,PLATANTHERA (BIFOLIA?), {COLCHICUM AUTUMNALE AND POTENTILLA {ERECTA.}THIS IS SURROUNDED BY MIXED WOODLAND.
WILDLIFE. THERE ARE{ FALLOW AND ROE DEER } WANDERING FREELY THROUGH THE PARK AND SOME{MUNTJAC. { FOXES, BADGERS, STOATS, WEASLES, {RABBITS, HARES AND SQUIRRELS}INHABIT THE AREA.
